With hurrying finger smite the fervid wire!</br>Th' intolerable rapture tears my soul,</br>I burn with Inspiration's fiercest fire,</br>In lawless liberty my senses roll</br>Beyond demurer Reason's coy control,</br>Beyond the sapient bounds, by Prudence laid,</br>And while unwonted fantasies inspire,</br>Amid th' interminable waste of shade,</br>In mad delirium lost, my daring tour is made!

Car'd in a cloud, of hyacinthine hue,</br>Pluck'd from the Lunar Shrine, aloft I rise;</br>And wond'rous sights, unutterable view,</br>Ting'd with a thousand strange, eye-shifting dyes,</br>Such as astound the weak, and daunt the wise,</br>But, often, by th' ecstatic gaze are seen,</br>When Fancy animates th' enamel'd skies</br>With radiant hosts minute, of wayward mien,</br>And dusky Moonlight cloathes the fay-encircled green.

High o'er headlong torrent's foamy fall,</br>Whose waters howl along the rugged steep,</br>On the loose-jutting rock, or mould'ring wall,</br>See!  where gaunt DANGER lays him down to sleep!</br>The piping winds his mournful vigil keep;</br>The light'nings blue his stony pillow warm;</br>Anon, incumbent o'er the dreary deep,</br>The fiend enormous strides the lab'ring storm,</br>And mid the thund'rous strife expands his giant-form.

The vital stream, propel'd from every part,</br>Tumultuous, leaves each veiny channel dry;</br>The purple flood flows heavy on my heart,</br>As startled MADNESS meets my blasted eye;</br>How lamentable, now, his loaded sigh,</br>Of horrible intent, and fix'd despair!</br>And, now again, with agonizing cry,</br>He beats his boxen cheek, he rends his hair,</br>'Till in hot tears is quench'd his eyeball's fiery glare!

The sudden light that flash'd athwart his brain,</br>Dread interval!  but more augments his woe;</br>Oft, has that bare head brav'd the dashing rain;</br>Its brown locks, oft been silver'd o'er with snow;</br>Ye savage tempests!  cease awhile to blow;</br>Ye angry heav'ns!  upfurl your sheeted flame;</br>From Love's deluding cup the poison's flow,</br>That drench in anguish his distracted frame,</br>That leave him man's fair form, without the boasted name.

Ah!  who is SHE, of dark unsettled brow,</br>That, bleeding, drags an angel-shape behind,</br>And quaffs the living gore? — I know her now!</br>'Tis JEALOUSY, that monster of the mind,</br>In whom are thousand contraries combin'd,</br>Now moping, melancholy, o'er the wild;</br>Now, fretful, rash, unreas'ning, unconfin'd;</br>In Constancy's best blood her hands defil'd;</br>And strangling in its birth her own devoted child.

From thee, severe, insinuative Pest!</br>Such crimes terrific, tragically, spring,</br>As in some tale, by Fear's pale lip exprest,</br>Bids the babe closer to the bosom cling,</br>And breathes amazement o'er the shudd'ring ring;</br>Ne'er may the stealing serpents, that devour</br>The roses wove in Love's purpureal wing,</br>With cureless venom taint Affection's flow'r,</br>Or coil your latent death's in my ANTHEMOE's bow'r!

Where is thy magic wand, to pourtray</br>This scene so fraught with shadows of surprize,</br>Oh!  Thou! who, fir'd by one eccentric ray</br>Of SHAKESPEARE, bad'st thy wild creation rise,</br>Revealing mystic rites to mortal eyes?</br>For lo, from Darkness' unexhausted womb,</br>Spectres, of horrid feature, hideous size,</br>Or unimagin'd pow'r, inform the gloom</br>With motion, and effect, and cheat the hungry tomb.

Here, bat-like portents cleave the murky air,</br>And flap, with strident scream, the leathern wing;</br>Some, like the tyger rushing from his lair,</br>Start from the dense profound, with furious spring;</br>Some, in shrill tone, their doleful dirges sing;</br>Some, with their iron fangs, prepare for prey;</br>Hiss the fell snakes; the rusty fetters ring;</br>Groans the rack'd wretch his stubborn soul away;</br>Or mid th' insatiate blaze half-figur'd goblins play.

Oh!  for one sprig of sacred mistletoe,</br>Spell-breaking vervain, or as potent rue,</br>To scare those imps malign who work me woe;</br>Oh!  for nine drops of cold nocturnal dew,</br>O'er my pale front with mutter'd sleight to strew!</br>Aloof, in sullen apathy repos'd,</br>Yon daemon huge I dread, of deadliest hue;</br>He rises, ghastly to my path oppos'd!—</br>Ah, close the fearful scene! — the fearful scene is clos'd.

Now, down the smooth declivity, I float</br>Of neither aether, to a shelter'd vale;</br>Where, in its balmy bosom lodg'd remote,</br>A bevy of bright beings I may hail;</br>Hark!  what sweet murmurs swell the musky gale,</br>Whose honied whispers joy and gladness give;</br>What tides of lusty health my lungs inhale;</br>What florid flushed my blank cheeks receive;</br>Here, in this happy dell, for ever would I live!

Minions of Moonlight!  let my slow step steal</br>Unblam'd, and guiltless, on your secret sport;</br>Removing soft the visionary veil,</br>That wraps from vulgar ken the Elfin-Court,</br>Where no unhallow'd visitants resort!</br>Lo!  where the Lords of Faery-land appear!</br>Chieftains, and frowning Peers of princely port;</br>Sage Councellors, with piercing eye severe,</br>And less distinguish'd knights fast trooping in the rear.

The Monarch's self majestic terrors grace,</br>Tip'd with a horse-fly's tongue, a rush his spear!</br>A gnat's slight pinion shades his martial face;</br>A fish's scale his armed shoulders wear,</br>Lin'd with a scarf of shining gossamer;</br>Unknown in listed fray the prize to yield,</br>His rapier is a hornet's sting severe;</br>Superior to the rest, his shelly shield</br>Undauntedly he shakes, and overlooks the field.

But, moving slow upon my dazzled sight,</br>What miracle is this of loveliest charm?</br>Luxuriate in unspeakable delight,</br>I feel, I feel my shiv'ring senses warm,</br>All my best feelings own the fond alarm;</br>The courteous semblance becks me to her side,</br>That beamy smile secures me from all harm,</br>Her mandate I obey with pleasing pride:</br>'Tis She! — the SYLPHID SHE! — my late aerial bride!

"Full ill, (she cries) my pupil, has thine ear</br>Receiv'd the moral lore, I, whilom, taught;</br>Tho' prodigal of fancy, who will hear</br>Thy numbers vague, with no instruction fraught,</br>And destitute of heav'n-descended thought;</br>Tho' slighting the severer rules of art,</br>With choicest cunning is the descant wrought,</br>If thou to lull the sense, neglect the heart,</br>Trust me, advent'rous youth!  we suddenly must part."

She spoke! — conviction follow'd as she spoke:</br>And tho' uncurb'd Imagination scorn,</br>To bend submissive to the servile yoke,</br>A temporary bondage must be borne;</br>The flaunting wild-rose decks the crabbed thorn;</br>From surly rules sublimest labours grew;</br>No more my stricter song must you adorn,</br>Ye Phantoms, ever fair, and ever new!—</br>Adieu, delightful dreams, ye faery scenes adieu!</br>
